name: Dublin Chamber of Commerce
goal: Dublin Chamber is the largest chamber of commerce in Ireland, with a multi-sector membership base of 1,300 companies, spanning the spectrum from start-ups to multinationals. It is the most representative and broadly-based business group in the Greater Dublin Area, providing representation, networking, and a range of business support services. Its policy work focuses on developing the region's infrastructure and transport offering, promoting competitiveness, and improving local governance. Dublin Chamber is also one of the oldest chambers of commerce in the world, tracing its origins back to 1782.
interests: Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: The Irish economy has been transformed since EU membership. Ireland's national legislative process has also been affected by EU membership and the expansion of competencies. In this context, Dublin Chamber is focused on issues that are of national interest as they are affected by policy developments in the European Commission, Council, and Parliament.
